ai.summary: A short, easy coastal walk of about 2.7 km to the Langdon Hill and Golden Cap area along the Jurassic Coast in the UK. The route offers sweeping views, grassy paths, and a gentle ascent to the hilltop.
ai.terrain_summary: Grassy, well-trodden paths with some uneven sections and a few exposed steps. Surface can be slippery in wet weather; expect a gentle ascent to the hilltop with coastal viewpoints. Some parts may have loose gravel near the edge, and portions run close to cliff edges.
ai.safety_notes: Stay well back from cliff edges and avoid unstable ground. Check weather and wind conditions before you go; coastal paths can become slick in rain or fog. Keep to marked paths, supervise children and dogs, and be cautious near ledges. If winds are strong or visibility is poor, consider postponing the walk. Carry a map or GPS, a charged phone for emergencies, and let someone know your plans.
recommended_gear: Map and/or GPS or a fully charged phone with offline maps
Light rain cover for your backpack
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) offer the best conditions for this coastal 2.7 km walk; summer provides longer daylight but can be windy, while winter can be windy and visibility may be poor.
